intro: Isodendrion hillebrandii, commonly known as the Hillebrand's thistle, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its spiny, upright stems and large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Isodendrion hillebrandii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
